results.title: Area 1: Barbara arrives in Arealand
results.creator_credit: Agency for Instructional Television and South Carolina TV Network
results.brief_description: In a journey “through her window” Barbara ventures into Arealand for the three programs in the MeasureArea cluster. She explores the concept of area and discovers a variety of ways to determine it with trhe help of many unusual fantasyland characters. In this program Barbara learns that area is two-dimensional and that “covering” is a process to determine area. She encounters square metre, square decimetre and square centimetre. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Are you ready for sex?
results.creator_credit: Sheri Gillette Espar, Henry Mayer and Mayer Espar Productions
results.brief_description: Through dramatization and student discussions, questions concerning sexual responsibility, inter-personal communication, peer group pressure, sexual maturity, personal values, sexual intercourse, the use of contraceptives and sexual abstinence are examined. The discussion has an American cultural bias. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Are drugs the answer?
results.brief_description: Dr. Cole, psychologist, and ex-student of Dr. Timothy Leary, leads a classroom discussion on the reasons for drug taking, informs on the three main categories of drugs, the need for education of young people and for criminal prosecution of drug dealers. The film was made with the co-operation of three U.S. high schools and their students. No other credits available.

results.title: Arctic people
results.brief_description: This film shows without commentary how hunting is the traditional means of livelihood for the Eskimos in the barren Canadian northland. It also indicates how the less hostile environment of the low Arctic permits the Lapps to engage in husbandry and fishing. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Arctic nomads
results.brief_description: Life at the tiny outpost of Masi, on the edge of the vast Finnmark plateau over which the nomadic Lapps have wandered for centuries. Lapp children are shown at their lessons in a school built be the Norwegian State. Out on the plateau a family is shown living a primitive tent life, and preparing their sledges and reindeer to migrate to the coast in the spring. No other credits available.

results.title: Arcs and sparks (Testing)
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the scientific idea that magnetism and electricity are related. Shows some safe ways to investigate that relationship. Suitable for Upper-Primary students.

results.title: Architecture west
results.brief_description: Shows examples of architecture in the Western American states beginning with the square log block house that served as General Sheridan’s headquarters at Yam Hill, Oregon. The Monterey style house built for the American consul to Mexican California, a Victorian mansion, the First Church of Christ Scientist at Berkeley, the steel-aluminium -glass Equitable Building in Portland, Oregon, the Prudential building in Los Angeles, and modern homes designed by John Yoen, depicting important influences and style.

results.title: Architecture of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.
results.description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.

results.title: Arches of faith
results.creator_credit: Kurt Baum and African Film Productions
results.brief_description: The Voortrekker Memorial, the story behind it and its dedication in 1949. Bas-reliefs on the memorial and re-enacted sequences show the Voortrekkers setting out across the Brakensberg to the Free State, Natal and Transvaal, the massacre of Piet Retief’s party by Dingaan and his Zulu warriors, the subsequent Voortrekker victory at Bloody River, and the establishment of new farmlands. The celebrations at the dedication of the Memorial and the sentiments behind it.

results.title: Archaeology in the laboratory
results.creator_credit: J.P. Baux and Service du Film de Recherche
results.brief_description: Presents a study of a cave, the Grotte du Lazaret, near Nice in France. Reveals much about the life of man 130,000 years ago. Includes studies of sedimentation, microscopic slides, isotopes of uranium and oxygen and pollen examinations. Gives a detailed analysis of man’s organization in this cave. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary students.
